choices.text:
in python calculate the average and standard deviation of a list of numbers
import statistics as stats

list_of_numbers = [1, 2, 3, 4]
average = sum(list_of_numbers) / len(list_of_numbers)
stddev = stats.stdev(list_of_numbers)
print('Average:', average)
print('Standard Deviation:', stddev)
```This code imports the statistics module and calculates the average of a list of numbers using the `sum` function and dividing by the length of the list. It also uses the `stdev` function from the statistics module to calculate the standard deviation.```
